storyInfo: Catherine tells Feist about the failed workers' protest twenty-six years ago, and leaves Feist and the Doctor with information about the supply line. Allerdale and Siege are being pursued by the Sarkaz.

attributes.content: Feist thought he was getting a talking to.
He was ready, thinking about what he could say to move the heart of the stubborn old worker before him.
Catherine has seen too much. Her temper is harder than the machines in the factory.
His cleverness with words has never been of any use before Catherine. Her fierce gaze sees through all, turning his wits to mush.
Feist feels a familiar sense of helplessness.
He always turns back into a little boy before his grandmother. Clumsy, excitable, prone to saying something he instantly regrets. He can only wait for his grandmother to speak first.
But Catherine says nothing.
She leads Feist down a long path. When they finally stop, he glances at her expression, and surprisingly sees no hint of anger.
What's up ahead?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Nothing.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I remember this workshop. You used to come here by yourself. Why is the production line empty, though?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: What did you think this place was?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The old workers wouldn't say, but Patto made a bet with Day that it's the secret workshop where they used to build steam armor.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Tell Patto he won the bet.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: So this is really the steam armor... no, I don't understand...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I've followed you down this path a few times. I heard... I heard the machines running, and the conveyor belt moving.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: They still run, if someone hits the switch.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Why was it abandoned? Because the Steam Knights disappeared? No, even without orders, these machines are too dear to be left idle.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Why... why indeed?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The aging worker pats the machine, as though she was asking the cold metal.
Feist realizes that all the machines are spotless, with nary a speck of dust on them. It is as though time has stopped in this secret workshop.
Do you know why I'm the only one who came here?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Cam, Mike, Branson... they should have been standing there. And Harvey, he'd be responsible for watching the thrusters.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: When the production line moves as one... I guarantee you've never heard a song quite like it.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Harvey... isn't that Dad's name?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Your dad was the smartest worker in the entire city. He came up with all sorts of crazy ideas.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I've only seen him in photos.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I wish you could have seen him in the flesh. You're like him... too much so, at times.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Harvey was an expert in steam engines. He was like an engine himself, going so fast that I couldn't keep up.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I should've kept up.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Didn't Dad go missing after getting caught in some business on the streets? That's what you said whenever I asked.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Some business... if what happened twenty-six years ago could be called as much.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Twenty-six years ago? Didn't His Majesty...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Yes. Londinium fell into chaos overnight, the nobles were at each other's throats, and the dukes led the way.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Lots of factories got hit, especially military ones making steam armor. We were forced to stop work.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Harvey... he was young then. Almost the same age as you now. He loved the factory, and he loved this city.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: He left the factory with the other workers to protest against the nobles. He wanted the dukes to hear the voices of the workers, and protect our livelihood.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Naive, wasn't he?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I think back to it, on quiet nights... was it a cold one in December? Was his blood warm when it came out of his chest?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Dad did it... for his ideals.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: You want to say how noble it is to sacrifice for your ideals?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: The leaders of your Self-Salvation Corps and that 'Doctor' of yours... is that what they say when they mourn their dead friends?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: It's what Commander Clovisia would say. As for the Doctor... the Doctor is even more quiet than usual at times like those. But I can feel the pure, heartfelt sincerity.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: The dead are in no position to appreciate their greatness.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: As for the ones they leave behind... these words of consolation are like cigarette smoke, light and fluffy, comforting for a moment, but when it leaves your lungs...
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: She takes a breath, a pause, then breathes out again.
The temperature is not low enough to leave a white fog.
Only one thing is for certain. Forty-one workers walked onto the largest street in Central Londinium on that night, twenty-six years ago. None came back.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Nothing changed about the city. The nobles, the wealthy, they pretend nothing happened, but this workshop would never be the same again.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I'm too old to train another group of workers as good as them, Feist.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: They should've taken over for me. Harvey should've been the one to teach you all you knew.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Granny...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Believe it or not, I've never blamed Harvey, and I've never blamed you.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: But think about it carefully. You should've thought about it carefully when you tried to lead Patto and the others into your rebellion.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: If you survive this war, but the others don't, will you be like me, fraught with grief and regret night after night, leaning over machines with no one to use them?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: I didn't understand your decision three years ago, Granny.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: But now, when I think back to that day, when I try to put myself in your shoes...
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: It would have taken me a long time to make that decision.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: You're right. Being smart isn't enough to fool death.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: But compromise and subservience won't get the job done either.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Catherine takes a drag on her cigarette and says nothing.
I can't say I've thought this through.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I can't guarantee we'll be able to drive out the Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I've been feeling the weight on my shoulders, ever since Rhodes Island told us that we didn't have much time.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: I'm afraid I'll do something stupid again.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: But I can't stop here.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Otherwise, I'll never be able to face Johnny, Gabby, and the Self-Salvation Corps fighters who gave their lives.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Too young... too naive, little brat.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: You there, 'Doctor'. You look like you've got a grip on yourself, unlike this boy.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Would you kindly take care of him?
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: There's a hidden compartment in the third drawer of my desk.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: The Sarkaz are watching closely. There's no place for you here. Read it and get out.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: Don't bring trouble to anyone else.
attributes.name: Catherine

attributes.content: ...Thanks, Granny.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: You catch a glimpse of Catherine's expression as she passes by you.
Sorrow, and gratification.
Let's take a look, Doctor.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Granny's room is over here.
attributes.name: Feist

attributes.content: Do you have the goods?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: All here.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: How's Mr. Bader?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I heard he's ill. Anyway, it's all here. Our business is concluded.
attributes.name: Londinium Citizen

attributes.content: Good. Please pass on my gratitude.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: One after another, heavily-armed mercenaries emerge from the warehouse.
Their leader walks towards the Self-Salvation Corps and extends the hand not holding a weapon.
Are you our new employer? I'm Totter.
Hello, Totter. Thank you for making the trip.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The container was a little stuffy.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Not that it's much different out here.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Hah. Welcome to Londinium.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Team 8, take our new friends to the base. Watch out for Sarkaz patrols.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am. Come with us.
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Fighter

attributes.content: The scales tip ever so slightly in our favor.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: We don't have much time left, Clovisia. They've began culling the nobles.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: We've evacuated the ducal residence and moved to Hideout Beta, which is better concealed. It's safe for now, but I'm not sure for how long.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The number of Sarkaz in the city is increasing.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The bulk of their forces will return in three days.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The Nachzehrer King... The terrible corpse eater.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Amiya told me about his powers. He 'eats' war... turning the battlefield into part of himself simply by standing on it.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: How do we defeat the battlefield itself?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The dukes' fleets must be united to win.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Our soldiers have to avoid him. That's why we need to move before he returns.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: They're living legends.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: The Sarkaz Royal Court... if they truly plan to suppress the entire city, over the heads of Lt. Colonel Lettou and the Defense Forces...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: You're good at math, Clovisia. What are the chances we triumph over these terrible legends?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Very good then. The Self-Salvation Corps didn't come this far by crunching numbers.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The fighters are doing their best.
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: Whatever may come, at least our hearts are one, aren't they, Allerdale?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: ...Huh? Oh, yes, of course.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: What are you thinking about?
attributes.name: Clovisia

attributes.content: I'm thinking... I hope tomorrow goes as well as these past few days have.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Don't you think they've been going a little too smoothly lately?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That's a good thing, innit?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Good things don't happen on their own.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I agree with Vina. You get lucky once, sure, but not every time.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hey, those men have been loitering for a while...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The man on the corner glances at them briefly.
He should not have been able to see so deep into the alley. But he suddenly pulls back his gaze, and briskly walks away with his head lowered.
Dagda!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Tell Allerdale... tell the Corps to evacuate the warehouse district immediately!
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Yes, Siege.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: They want to know why.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: We are being watched... no time to explain.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Dagda, Indra, Morgan. Proceed with the plan.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Fighter

attributes.content: Is everyone out?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I... I don't know...
attributes.name: Self-Salvation Corps Fighter

attributes.content: Run now. Talk later.
attributes.name: Siege
